forumNotes.author: allanf
forumNotes.content:
You should be able to do it with Vista/Win7 Boot Manager. Here's a document with sample bcdedit commands, and some arguments as to why MS believes it should be done this way.  

[Custom Bootstrap Actions in Windows Vista](http://download.microsoft.com/download/9/c/5/9c5b2167-8017-4bae-9fde-d599bac8184a/OEMBoot_Vista.doc "External link")  

Someone else has done it: [Custom launch mechanism (e.g F10) on Vista - Server Fault](http://serverfault.com/questions/65534/custom-launch-mechanism-e-g-f10-on-vista "External link")  

You'd be best to run a robust script from a boot disk in order to set everything up on each computer. To get some idea, there's a basic example of a VB Script linked to this article: [Dual Booting with Windows XP and Windows PE 2.0](http://technet.microsoft.com/en-au/magazine/2008.02.desktopfiles.aspx "External link")  
Download: [http://download.micr...ktop2008_02.exe](http://download.microsoft.com/download/f/d/0/fd05def7-68a1-4f71-8546-25c359cc0842/Desktop2008_02.exe "External link")  

Yours would need to be somewhat more complex!
